intro: Tetrapterys tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima tetraptery, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and distinctive palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
